org.openliberty.openaz.azapi.pep
Interface PepResponseFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
PepResponseFactoryImpl
public interface PepResponseFactory

Factory for creating and configuring PepResponse.
This class creates PepResponse objects and configures the behavior of how the PepResponse interprets the results from the AzService.
The PepResponseBehavior can either be to

  • return true (PERMIT: PepResponseBehavior.RETURN_YES),
  • return false (DENY: PepResponseBehavior.RETURN_NO),
  • or throw an exception (DENY: PepResponseBehavior.THROW_EXCEPTION).

In general, a Permit returns true, and a Deny returns false, but there are also other types of returns, including NotApplicable and Indeterminate. The configuration is to specify for each of the 4 xacml-defined conditions, what the behavior will be. i.e. for each of the "special" conditions there is a choice to return either true (Permit), false (Deny), or throw an Exception.

Author:
Josh Bregman, Rich Levinson, Prateek Mishra

getMissingAttributeBehavior

PepResponseBehavior getMissingAttributeBehavior()
Get the PepResponseBehavior that has been set to be applied when an indeterminate due to missing attributes is returned.
i.e. when the underlying AzDecision is AzDecision.AZ_INDETERMINATE
and the underlying AzStatusCode is AzStatusCode.AZ_MISSING_ATTRIBUTE.

Returns:
a PepResponseBehavior enum value

getNotApplicableBehavior

i.e. when the underlying AzDecision is AzDecision.AZ_NOTAPPLICABLE

Returns:
a PepResponseBehavior enum value
